abstract: The Occupy Wall Street protests have encouraged students at some of the nation's top colleges to pursue antibank activism, beginning with their schools' on-campus recruiting programs.
snippet: The Occupy Wall Street protests have encouraged students at some of the nation's top colleges to pursue antibank activism, beginning with their schools' on-campus recruiting programs.
lead_paragraph: As protesters affiliated with the Occupy Wall Street movement continue to camp out in lower Manhattan's Zuccotti Park, students at some of the nation's top colleges are also taking up the banner of antibank activism, beginning with their schools' on-campus recruiting programs.

headline.main: Wall Street Protests Inspire Ire Over Bank Recruiting
